clinical_study.brief_title: Pulmonary Rehabilitation Innovation and Microbiota in Exacerbations of COPD
clinical_study.official_title: Pulmonary Rehabilitation Innovation and Microbiota in Exacerbations of COPD

brief_summary.textblock: PRIME goal is to early detect and treat acute exacerbations of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (AECOPD). This is important since COPD accelerates aging and represents major burden worldwide and in Portugal, mainly due to its frequent AECOPD. Pulmonary rehabilitation (PR) is an effective strategy of its management but it is scarce. When AECOPD are early detected and treated, it optimizes patients' outcomes and reduces the burden of COPD, especially if PR is used. However, up to date, there is no model to predict AECOPD for clinical practice. The lung microbiota shows promise to overcome this barrier and inform on COPD trajectory and will be investigated. In addition, despite of most AECOPD being managed in the community, PR is mainly available in hospitals and less than 1% of patients are having access. Thus, community-based PR will be implemented and a clinical decision tool developed for prioritizing who will most benefit from PR, enhancing evidence-based access to PR.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 156 patients with COPD will be followed monthly for a year and their lung microbiota and clinical data will be analysed. Community-based PR will be delivered to 56 patients. Data will be collected before, at 3 weeks, after PR and at 6 months to assess the feasibility and effects of PR.

primary_outcome.description: exercise tolerance in a walking field test

secondary_outcome.description: Upper and lower limb muscle strength

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in health related Quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with the St. George's Respiratory Questionnaire, that measures health related quality of life. It will be used the total score. Scores are expressed as a percentage of overall impairment where 100 represents worst possible health status and 0 indicates best possible health status.

Resting dyspnoea measured with the modified British medical research council dyspnoea questionnaire, that ranges from 0 to 4, and is related to dyspnoea during activities of daily living. Higher scores demonstrate a higher functional impairment due to dyspnoea.
self-efficacy measured with the pulmonary rehabilitation adapted index of self-efficacy tool
Physical activity levels measured with the brief physical activity assessment tool
Lung function will be assessed through spirometry to define the airflow limitation (FEV1pp).
Number of emergency visits on the previous year
Number of exacerbations on previous year
Number of hospitalizations on previous year
Dyspnoea experienced during exercise, monitored with the modified Borg dyspnoea scale, that ranges from 0 to 10, where 0 represents no dyspnoea and 10 the worst imaginable dyspnoea.
Fatigue experienced during exercise, monitored with the modified Borg dyspnoea scale, that ranges from 0 to 10, where 0 represents no fatigue and 10 the worst fatigue the patient can imagine.

arm_group.description: Pulmonary rehabilitation will be provided to every patient that accepts the intervention and presents an acute exacerbation

intervention.description: Pulmonary rehabilitation will be provided to patients presenting an acute exacerbation. The intervention will be composed of exercise training, education and psychosocial support.
